alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Jackson; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 11:53PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Buffalo, northwestern Jackson and northern Trempealeau Counties through 1245 AM CDT... At 1146 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles north of Strum to 6 miles northwest of Modena. This line will produce frequent lightning and maybe some hail as it moves east at 30 mph across northeastern Buffalo, northern Trempealeau, and northwestern Jackson counties. HAZARD...Frequent lightning and SOURCE...Radar, satellite, and lightning monitoring network. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Strum around 1155 PM CDT. Mondovi around 1205 AM CDT. Osseo around 1210 AM CDT. Price around 1225 AM CDT. Independence around 1240 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Gilmanton, Chimney Rock, Mondovi Airfield, Elk Creek, The Big Swamp Area, The Borst Valley Area, Eleva, Pleasantville, and Levis. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for central Wisconsin.
